00076 #define BN_SQR_COMBA

00079 /* This next option uses the C libraries (2 word)/(1 word) function.
00080  * If it is not defined, I use my C version (which is slower).
00081  * The reason for this flag is that when the particular C compiler
00082  * library routine is used, and the library is linked with a different
00083  * compiler, the library is missing.  This mostly happens when the
00084  * library is built with gcc and then linked using normal cc.  This would
00085  * be a common occurrence because gcc normally produces code that is
00086  * 2 times faster than system compilers for the big number stuff.
00087  * For machines with only one compiler (or shared libraries), this should
00088  * be on.  Again this in only really a problem on machines
00089  * using "long long's", are 32bit, and are not using my assembler code. */
00090 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYS_MSDOS) || defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WINDOWS) || \
00091     defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32) || defined(linux)
00092 # ifndef BN_DIV2W
00093 #  define BN_DIV2W
00094 # endif
00095 #endif
00096 
00097 /* assuming long is 64bit - this is the DEC Alpha
00098  * unsigned long long is only 64 bits :-(, don't define
00099  * BN_LLONG for the DEC Alpha */
00100 #ifdef SIXTY_FOUR_BIT_LONG
00101 #define BN_ULLONG   unsigned long long
00102 #define BN_ULONG    unsigned long
00103 #define BN_LONG     long
00104 #define BN_BITS     128
00105 #define BN_BYTES    8
00106 #define BN_BITS2    64
00107 #define BN_BITS4    32
00108 #define BN_MASK     (0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffLL)
00109 #define BN_MASK2    (0xffffffffffffffffL)
00110 #define BN_MASK2l   (0xffffffffL)
00111 #define BN_MASK2h   (0xffffffff00000000L)
00112 #define BN_MASK2h1  (0xffffffff80000000L)
00113 #define BN_TBIT     (0x8000000000000000L)
00114 #define BN_DEC_CONV (10000000000000000000UL)
00115 #define BN_DEC_FMT1 "%lu"
00116 #define BN_DEC_FMT2 "%019lu"
00117 #define BN_DEC_NUM  19
00118 #endif
00119 
00120 /* This is where the long long data type is 64 bits, but long is 32.
00121  * For machines where there are 64bit registers, this is the mode to use.
00122  * IRIX, on R4000 and above should use this mode, along with the relevant
00123  * assembler code :-).  Do NOT define BN_LLONG.
00124  */
00125 #ifdef SIXTY_FOUR_BIT
00126 #undef BN_LLONG
00127 #undef BN_ULLONG
00128 #define BN_ULONG    unsigned long long
00129 #define BN_LONG     long long
00130 #define BN_BITS     128
00131 #define BN_BYTES    8
00132 #define BN_BITS2    64
00133 #define BN_BITS4    32
00134 #define BN_MASK2    (0xffffffffffffffffLL)
00135 #define BN_MASK2l   (0xffffffffL)
00136 #define BN_MASK2h   (0xffffffff00000000LL)
00137 #define BN_MASK2h1  (0xffffffff80000000LL)
00138 #define BN_TBIT     (0x8000000000000000LL)
00139 #define BN_DEC_CONV (10000000000000000000ULL)
00140 #define BN_DEC_FMT1 "%llu"
00141 #define BN_DEC_FMT2 "%019llu"
00142 #define BN_DEC_NUM  19
00143 #endif
00144 
00145 #ifdef THIRTY_TWO_BIT
00146 #if defined(OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32) && !defined(__GNUC__)
00147 #define BN_ULLONG   unsigned _int64
00148 #else
00149 #define BN_ULLONG   unsigned long long
00150 #endif
00151 #define BN_ULONG    unsigned long
00152 #define BN_LONG     long
00153 #define BN_BITS     64
00154 #define BN_BYTES    4
00155 #define BN_BITS2    32
00156 #define BN_BITS4    16
00157 #ifdef OPENSSL_SYS_WIN32
00158 /* VC++ doesn't like the LL suffix */
00159 #define BN_MASK     (0xffffffffffffffffL)
00160 #else
00161 #define BN_MASK     (0xffffffffffffffffLL)
00162 #endif
00163 #define BN_MASK2    (0xffffffffL)
00164 #define BN_MASK2l   (0xffff)
00165 #define BN_MASK2h1  (0xffff8000L)
00166 #define BN_MASK2h   (0xffff0000L)
00167 #define BN_TBIT     (0x80000000L)
00168 #define BN_DEC_CONV (1000000000L)
00169 #define BN_DEC_FMT1 "%lu"
00170 #define BN_DEC_FMT2 "%09lu"
00171 #define BN_DEC_NUM  9
00172 #endif
00173 
00174 #ifdef SIXTEEN_BIT
00175 #ifndef BN_DIV2W
00176 #define BN_DIV2W
00177 #endif
00178 #define BN_ULLONG   unsigned long
00179 #define BN_ULONG    unsigned short
00180 #define BN_LONG     short
00181 #define BN_BITS     32
00182 #define BN_BYTES    2
00183 #define BN_BITS2    16
00184 #define BN_BITS4    8
00185 #define BN_MASK     (0xffffffff)
00186 #define BN_MASK2    (0xffff)
00187 #define BN_MASK2l   (0xff)
00188 #define BN_MASK2h1  (0xff80)
00189 #define BN_MASK2h   (0xff00)
00190 #define BN_TBIT     (0x8000)
00191 #define BN_DEC_CONV (100000)
00192 #define BN_DEC_FMT1 "%u"
00193 #define BN_DEC_FMT2 "%05u"
00194 #define BN_DEC_NUM  5
00195 #endif
00196 
00197 #ifdef EIGHT_BIT
00198 #ifndef BN_DIV2W
00199 #define BN_DIV2W
00200 #endif
00201 #define BN_ULLONG   unsigned short
00202 #define BN_ULONG    unsigned char
00203 #define BN_LONG     char
00204 #define BN_BITS     16
00205 #define BN_BYTES    1
00206 #define BN_BITS2    8
00207 #define BN_BITS4    4
00208 #define BN_MASK     (0xffff)
00209 #define BN_MASK2    (0xff)
00210 #define BN_MASK2l   (0xf)
00211 #define BN_MASK2h1  (0xf8)
00212 #define BN_MASK2h   (0xf0)
00213 #define BN_TBIT     (0x80)
00214 #define BN_DEC_CONV (100)
00215 #define BN_DEC_FMT1 "%u"
00216 #define BN_DEC_FMT2 "%02u"
00217 #define BN_DEC_NUM  2
00218 #endif

00226 #define BN_FLG_MALLOCED     0x01
00227 #define BN_FLG_STATIC_DATA  0x02
00228 #define BN_FLG_FREE     0x8000  /* used for debuging */
00229 #define BN_set_flags(b,n)   ((b)->flags|=(n))
00230 #define BN_get_flags(b,n)   ((b)->flags&(n))
00231 
00232 typedef struct bignum_st
00233     {
00234     BN_ULONG *d;    /* Pointer to an array of 'BN_BITS2' bit chunks. */
00235     int top;    /* Index of last used d +1. */
00236     /* The next are internal book keeping for bn_expand. */
00237     int dmax;   /* Size of the d array. */
00238     int neg;    /* one if the number is negative */
00239     int flags;
00240     } BIGNUM;
00241 
00242 /* Used for temp variables (declaration hidden in bn_lcl.h) */
00243 typedef struct bignum_ctx BN_CTX;
00244 
00245 typedef struct bn_blinding_st
00246     {
00247     int init;
00248     BIGNUM *A;
00249     BIGNUM *Ai;
00250     BIGNUM *mod; /* just a reference */
00251     unsigned long thread_id; /* added in OpenSSL 0.9.6j and 0.9.7b;
00252                   * used only by crypto/rsa/rsa_eay.c, rsa_lib.c */
00253     } BN_BLINDING;
00254 
00255 /* Used for montgomery multiplication */
00256 typedef struct bn_mont_ctx_st
00257     {
00258     int ri;        /* number of bits in R */
00259     BIGNUM RR;     /* used to convert to montgomery form */
00260     BIGNUM N;      /* The modulus */
00261     BIGNUM Ni;     /* R*(1/R mod N) - N*Ni = 1
00262                     * (Ni is only stored for bignum algorithm) */
00263     BN_ULONG n0;   /* least significant word of Ni */
00264     int flags;
00265     } BN_MONT_CTX;
00266 
00267 /* Used for reciprocal division/mod functions
00268  * It cannot be shared between threads
00269  */
00270 typedef struct bn_recp_ctx_st
00271     {
00272     BIGNUM N;   /* the divisor */
00273     BIGNUM Nr;  /* the reciprocal */
00274     int num_bits;
00275     int shift;
00276     int flags;
00277     } BN_RECP_CTX;
00278 
00279 #define BN_prime_checks 0 /* default: select number of iterations
00280                  based on the size of the number */
00281 
00282 /* number of Miller-Rabin iterations for an error rate  of less than 2^-80
00283  * for random 'b'-bit input, b >= 100 (taken from table 4.4 in the Handbook
00284  * of Applied Cryptography [Menezes, van Oorschot, Vanstone; CRC Press 1996];
00285  * original paper: Damgaard, Landrock, Pomerance: Average case error estimates
00286  * for the strong probable prime test. -- Math. Comp. 61 (1993) 177-194) */
00287 #define BN_prime_checks_for_size(b) ((b) >= 1300 ?  2 : \
00288                                 (b) >=  850 ?  3 : \
00289                                 (b) >=  650 ?  4 : \
00290                                 (b) >=  550 ?  5 : \
00291                                 (b) >=  450 ?  6 : \
00292                                 (b) >=  400 ?  7 : \
00293                                 (b) >=  350 ?  8 : \
00294                                 (b) >=  300 ?  9 : \
00295                                 (b) >=  250 ? 12 : \
00296                                 (b) >=  200 ? 15 : \
00297                                 (b) >=  150 ? 18 : \
00298                                 /* b >= 100 */ 27)
00299 
00300 #define BN_num_bytes(a) ((BN_num_bits(a)+7)/8)
00301 
00302 /* Note that BN_abs_is_word does not work reliably for w == 0 */
00303 #define BN_abs_is_word(a,w) (((a)->top == 1) && ((a)->d[0] == (BN_ULONG)(w)))
00304 #define BN_is_zero(a)       (((a)->top == 0) || BN_abs_is_word(a,0))
00305 #define BN_is_one(a)        (BN_abs_is_word((a),1) && !(a)->neg)
00306 #define BN_is_word(a,w)     ((w) ? BN_abs_is_word((a),(w)) && !(a)->neg : \
00307                                    BN_is_zero((a)))
00308 #define BN_is_odd(a)        (((a)->top > 0) && ((a)->d[0] & 1))
00309 
00310 #define BN_one(a)   (BN_set_word((a),1))
00311 #define BN_zero(a)  (BN_set_word((a),0))
00312

00458 /* library internal functions */
00459 
00460 #define bn_expand(a,bits) ((((((bits+BN_BITS2-1))/BN_BITS2)) <= (a)->dmax)?\
00461     (a):bn_expand2((a),(bits)/BN_BITS2+1))
00462 #define bn_wexpand(a,words) (((words) <= (a)->dmax)?(a):bn_expand2((a),(words)))
00463 BIGNUM *bn_expand2(BIGNUM *a, int words);
